entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 6:36AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Along the Coast Today... From Point Hope south to the Yukon Delta water levels have peaked out 4 ft above normal at most measuring sites. Water levels should remain steady today before falling tonight. This has caused water to rise up through cracks in the sea ice and pushed water on top of the ice in some areas. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 6:33AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Along the Coast Today... Elevated sea water along the coast from Point Barrow to Cape Lisburne is expected to peak today at 2 to 3 ft above normal.
